# Setting up the directory structure

The directory structure is modeled on an R package used as a "Research compendium" as described by [Marwick et al. 2018](https://peerj.com/preprints/3192v2/).

The basic project structure contains the following directories and files

* R.proj file
* DESCRIPTION file
* README.md file
* LICENCE file (optional, only necessary for publication)
* NAMESPACE (autogenerated file that exports R functions for repeated use)
* R/
    * directory containing R functions (generate them via devtools::ure_r(), devtools::load_all(), and devtools::document() (see [R packages](https://r-pkgs.org/index.html) for more details)
* man/
    * directory containg documentation for the functions in the R/ directory
* templates/
    * directory containing templates, e.g. `.csl` files to set citation and reference list style, etc.
* data/
    * with subdirectories containing 
        * raw data files
        * derived data files
        * external data files, e.g. further information provided by the scientist
* figures/
    * directory containing figures generated during the analysis
* vignettes/
    * directory containing final reports (based on the analysis files)
* analysis/
    * individual `.Rmd` files with the individual analysis steps carried out

Note that not all the folders need to be generated for all projects. The following will generate the minimal directory structure

We first need to write the DESCRIPTION file. We base the DESCRIPTION file on the information available in the `.babs` file:
```{r}
proj_info <- read_tsv("./.babs", col_names = FALSE) %>% 
  separate(col = X1, into = c("descriptor", "specification"), sep =":")

min_R_version <- str_c("R", "(>= ", R.version$major, ".", R.version$minor, ")", sep = "")

description <-
  str_c(
    str_to_title(proj_info$specification[proj_info$descriptor == "Type"]),
    " analysis for",
    proj_info$specification[proj_info$descriptor == "Scientist"],
    " with the project title" ,
    proj_info$specification[proj_info$descriptor == "Scititle"],
    ". For more information please refer to the project proposal .docx in ./data/raw_data/project_docs.",
    sep = ""
  )
```


```{r, eval=FALSE}
usethis::use_description(
  fields = list(
    Package = proj_info %>%
      filter(descriptor == "Lims") %>%
      pull(specification),
    Title = proj_info %>%
      filter(descriptor == "Scititle") %>%
      pull(specification),
    Depends = min_R_version,
    Description = description
  ),
  check_name = FALSE
)
```

After having generated the DESCRIPTION file, we can use the functions that are part of the `devtools` universe.

```{r}
# generate a file for a function to be used project-wide
# The code for the function needs to be copied into the newly generated file from the command below
use_r("generate_directories") 
```

```{r}
# for documenting the function insert cursor in the function definition in the appropriate .R file, go to Code> Insert roxygen skeleton
# fill out the skeleton with the appropriate information
# finish manual creation for that function with
devtools::document()
```

```{r}
# load_all() makes the functions in the R/ directory available for usage
pkgload::load_all()
```



```{r}
map(c("data/raw_data/project_docs", "data/derived_data", "figures", "vignettes", "analysis/scripts"), ~{
  generate_directories(.x)
})
```

```{r}
filesstrings::move_files(list.files(".", pattern = ".docx$"), destinations = "./data/raw_data/project_docs/")
```

```{r}
proj_info <- proj_info %>%

raw_data_base <- str_c(
```



# Note to installing Monocle3 in the OnDemand RStudio:
For installing Monocle3 ask for the following modules to be activated for the session
```{bash}
ml rgdal/1.5-16-foss-2020a-R-4.0.0 PROJ/7.0.0-GCCcore-9.3.0
```

Follow the instruction [here](https://cole-trapnell-lab.github.io/monocle3/docs/installation/) regarding the required Bioconductor packages and the leidenbase(`renv::install('cole-trapnell-lab/monocle3')`).

Install the rgdal package in RStudio:
```{r, eval=FALSE}
renv::install("rgdal")
```

The `sf` R library (dependency of  Monocle3) need to be installed from their github rather than the CRAN package.
In addition, an environmental variable needs to be set in R to ensure that the rgdal and proj7 modules work properly.
```{bash}
Sys.setenv(PKG_CONFIG_PATH = "/camp/apps/eb/software/PROJ/7.0.0-GCCcore-9.3.0/lib/pkgconfig:/camp/apps/testfolder/eb/software/cURL/7.69.1-GCCcore-9.3.0/lib/pkgconfig:/camp/apps/testfolder/eb/software/LibTIFF/4.1.0-GCCcore-9.3.0/lib/pkgconfig:/camp/apps/testfolder/eb/software/libjpeg-turbo/2.0.4-GCCcore-9.3.0/lib64/pkgconfig:/camp/apps/testfolder/eb/software/SQLite/3.31.1-GCCcore-9.3.0/lib/pkgconfig:/camp/apps/testfolder/eb/software/Tcl/8.6.10-GCCcore-9.3.0/lib/pkgconfig:/camp/apps/testfolder/eb/software/zlib/1.2.11-GCCcore-9.3.0/lib/pkgconfig:/camp/apps/testfolder/eb/software/libreadline/8.0-GCCcore-9.3.0/lib/pkgconfig")
```


After that Moncle3 can be installed
```{r, eval=FALSE}
renv::install("bioc::alevinQC")
renv::install("bioc::tximeta")
renv::install("bioc::org.Hs.eg.db")
renv::install("bioc::plyranges")
renv::install("locfit@1.5-9.4")
renv::install("bioc::DropletUtils")
renv::install("bioc::SingleCellExperiment")
renv::install("bioc::scDblFinder")
renv::install("bioc::glmGamPoi")
renv::install('ChristopherBarrington/scviewer')
system("source activate R-4.0.2-BABS")
renv::install("mojaveazure/seurat-disk")
```


Note on installing the `hdf5r` package that is required for the `SeuratDisk` package:
Ensure that the onDemand session was loaded with the following module: `HDF5/1.12.1-gompi-2021b` 
```{r}
Sys.setenv("CPATH" = "/camp/apps/testfolder/eb/software/HDF5/1.10.6-gompi-2020a/include:/camp/apps/testfolder/eb/software/Szip/2.1.1-GCCcore-9.3.0/include:/camp/apps/testfolder/eb/software/OpenMPI/4.0.3-GCC-9.3.0/include:/camp/apps/testfolder/eb/software/UCX/1.8.0-GCCcore-9.3.0/include:/camp/apps/testfolder/eb/software/hwloc/2.2.0-GCCcore-9.3.0/include:/camp/apps/testfolder/eb/software/libpciaccess/0.16-GCCcore-9.3.0/include:/camp/apps/testfolder/eb/software/libxml2/2.9.10-GCCcore-9.3.0/include/libxml2:/camp/apps/testfolder/eb/software/libxml2/2.9.10-GCCcore-9.3.0/include:/camp/apps/testfolder/eb/software/XZ/5.2.5-GCCcore-9.3.0/include:/camp/apps/testfolder/eb/software/numactl/2.0.13-GCCcore-9.3.0/include:/camp/apps/testfolder/eb/software/binutils/2.34-GCCcore-9.3.0/include:/camp/apps/testfolder/eb/software/zlib/1.2.11-GCCcore-9.3.0/include")
```

Install as follows from github:
```{r}
devtools::install_github("hhoeflin/hdf5r", configure.args = '--with-hdf5=/camp/apps/eb/software/HDF5/1.10.6-gompi-2020a/bin/h5pcc', type = 'source')
```
